channel.title: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?
channel.description:
Would love to know which your favorite sounds are--the ones you tend to use a lot? The reason I'm asking is that we're putting together a collection of sorts, so would be good to know which sounds people tend to use the most.
Helpful if you could list your 3-5 favorites below!

item.title: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
I also got great use of the Black octopus Vocal packs, really repurposing them in new combinations… Could use a few more of those!

Read full topic
item.source: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?

item.title: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
I definitely use favorites, and if I can’t find it there, browse by category. There are a few packs I know to go to for certain sounds as well. I generally decide on which sounds seem the most useful shortly after getting a new pack, and add them to favorites. Every now and then I will find a way of using a sound that I hadn’t anticipated initially, humus is a great example.

Read full topic
item.source: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?

item.title: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
Lately: Noir, Humus, 8080, Sloth, Crunchy Saw.

Blanket, Silk, Atom, Fragment, Purr, Doodle are older faves.

item.source: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?

item.title: Which are your top 5 favorite sounds?
item.dc:creator: Riff
item.description:
I know I’m really late on this one, but you know. New sounds, new topics, new favourites.

Let’s start with Miffy from Mixed Messages. Boy do I adore this sound. I use this in pretty much all my tracks. Just add reverb, turn the release down to 100, and you got yourself a cool pluck!
https://app.auxy.co/projects/BJkjhZvRPKcmLdes6_W9sw==

Coconut from Melodic Percussion. Lots of people use this sound/instrument, and I am one of them. This instrument has to be no. 1! Used correctly, it could sound rad…
https://app.auxy.co/projects/HVxc_z3EBPMnXoulufzI0g==

Sloth from Sublab 2. This is my go-to Bass for any genre (Specifically Dubstep and Dub). It’s just ‘Real Deep’ but better. Nothing else I can really say…
https://app.auxy.co/projects/Y8uXF0IJ1_UKPUXfoKROxw==

Silk from 7 Skies Selection. Ok, this sound is soo popular. But man alive, how can you not say it’s a good pad. I use it in pretty much every DnB track…
https://app.auxy.co/projects/Qx94ZQ87knYY4BoKce9pcA==

8080 from Euphoric Memories. This sound is so underrated and unused. It fits really well between Sweet Square and Silk. I use this and Silk together a lot of the time I use it…
https://app.auxy.co/projects/OYN4Pc5hoKBts3dHroP4hg==

Nugget from The OGs. I use Nugget quite interestingly… As you saw in the last project (if you haven’t, go now…), I used nugget as a pad AND pluck. If you add ducker and June over the top, then you have a good pad sound. For example:
https://app.auxy.co/projects/rt-rPCoTxNTsZy_w7qOfeg==

Electric Acoustic from DX100 From Mars. I very rarely use this sound, but when I hear it through the sound menu, it sounds phenomenal!

Clever from Standard Deviation. Ok, you should know why I like this sound so much. If not, PERFECT RISER. But in the project below, I used it interestingly.
https://app.auxy.co/projects/lVbu2anCbp7Yewm88aflfQ==

Orbit/Vintage from Standard Deviation. The reason I put these 2 sound together is because I use them in the same way. Melody.

Zombie from Panic Attack. I think you saw this one comin’. If you haven’t heard my track ‘All The Time’, then you won’t know what I’m talking about. But Zombie is a great Half-DnB Bass. FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, USE IT IN YOUR NEXT DNB TRACK !

Read full topic
